message_1: Suppose we have a Morse-Smale complex with $6$ critical points, $3$ of which are index $1$ and the other $3$ are index $2$. How many $1$-dimensional descending manifolds are there in this complex?
message_2: In a Morse-Smale complex, each critical point of index $k$ has a descending manifold of dimension $k$. Since there are $3$ critical points of index $1$, there will be $3$ one-dimensional descending manifolds in this complex.
